sentence.text: Soon , that string will run out and the balloon tug itself free and be lost .
Then he glanced aside , and yelled , ` Watch out ! " as he tugged his axe free .
It unrolled as he tugged it across the bedroom floor , and inside was the blood-soaked corpse of Maria Shill .
Mr Yarrow tugged a long card-index box across the desk and set about it with a bespittled finger .
I tugged him gently along the walkway , which was made of planks , I discovered , with short mooring posts sticking up at intervals , needing me to lift his legs over one at a time .
Holly took the bread and tugged it between his fingers and wolfed it to his mouth .
Blanche tugged a handkerchief from her bag and blew her nose violently as if to remove the smell of urine from her nostrils .
She tugged the silver medallion from her dress .
The girl tugged a handkerchief from the pocket of her dress and blew her nose .
Eagerly she tugged the card off the Cellophane wrapping -- then stared at it in confusion .
He tugged a fur-lined hat over his cropped white hair as he approached the transit van , his eyes riveted on Vasili 's face .
Dropping her head , she tugged a brush vigorously through the rippling red-gold , and then tossed it all back in a wild wavy curtain .
` Do n't be silly ! " snaps the woman , tugging her offspring through the throng .
Catching her hand , he began tugging her back towards the car .
She twined her fingers through Piers 's and tugged him towards the door .
Nina took her hand again , and tugged her away from the open door .
One of them began to tug his carbine out of its holster .
He sighed and tugged her closer .
Suddenly he reached out and tugged a small , black feather from the fringe of his cloak .
And he strode to her , grabbing her wrist and tugging her upstairs .
The waters of the world 's oceans are tugged outwards by the gravitational pull of the moon : a hill of water forms in the middle of the ocean when the moon is appropriately positioned above it .
At the end of the second hymn -- Ye -- Holy -- Angels -- Bright -- Who-o-o-o wait at God 's right hand ! -- Henry found himself being tugged forward by Elinor .
Then I felt my sleeve being tugged downwards and my feet swept from under me and suddenly I was lying next to Werewolf .
A section of the hardboard wall was tugged aside , and Chrissie glimpsed the pale , unshaven features of the man who lived in the concealed room .
The gag was tugged back into place , cutting off Connelly 's exhortations for mercy .
NATO 's discomfort will grow if reform spreads to perestroika-resistant East Germany ; West Germany would be tugged harder towards neutrality and thoughts of re-unification .
She felt her eyelids dropping and woke just in time to feel her hand being tugged towards the throbbing drums .
Here , we are concerned with the former , relaxed and floppy , with huge jackets as comfortable as cardigans and roomy trousers designed to be tugged in with a sturdy leather belt .
Tugging her hat straight , Ellie followed them into the hotel .
The weight of the engine tugged his nose down and he had to keep tugging it up again .
I tugged the ribbon and lifted the lid and heard myself give a harsh shout of anger and rejection and probably shame .
It was a very gentle push , which Yanto did not believe was a serious attempt to stop him , so , as he swayed back against her , he tugged them down another inch .
But something inside me was tugging in the other direction .
Harry tugged back the curtains and squinted out at the painful brightness of a frosty morning .
“ If you did , you 'd never try to pull the wool … ” he reached up and tugged down her hat further over her forehead “ … over my eyes , ” he breathed .
He paused as he tugged off the filthy tarpaulin .
He began to tug off his mask .
Together , by getting their fingers in the rat-holes , they managed to tug up a few feet of rotten chestnut boarding , tindery at the edges .
Fearon dragged it on over his sweater , tugged a disreputable flat cap over his wet hair and set off briskly towards the yard .
